meanings.definition: Protruding objects or features that are noticeable or prominent.
meanings.sent1: The stickouts on the tree were the colorful leaves.
meanings.sent2: I almost tripped on the stickouts of the uneven sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The stickouts on the cake were the candles, making it look festive.
meanings.sent4: The stickouts of the mountain range were visible from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The stickouts of the sculpture gave it a unique and striking appearance.

meanings.definition: To extend outward or project from a surface.
meanings.sent1: The branches stickouts from the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to stickouts its paws when playing.
meanings.sent3: The toast stickouts of the toaster when it's done.
meanings.sent4: The sun stickouts over the horizon in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals stickouts from the center of the bloom.

meanings.definition: To stand out or be easily seen.
meanings.sent1: Her bright red coat stickouts in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The typo in the document stickouts immediately.
meanings.sent3: The clown's nose stickouts comically in the circus.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stickouts against the dark night sky.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign stickouts brightly in the dim alleyway.
